#Text=Five of six accused over Egyptian ferry fire that killed over 1,000 are acquitted
#Text=Monday , July 28 , 2008
#Text=Five of the six defendants accused of manslaughter over the 2006 fire on board Egyptian ferry al-Salam Boccaccio 98 have been cleared of all charges .
#Text=The February 3 fire and subsequent sinking killed 1,034 of around 1,400 passengers .
#Text=Mamdouh Ismail , owner of the al-Salam company , his son and three company executives were all cleared of manslaughter .
#Text=Ismail is a member of parliament directly appointed by the president , and both he , his son and another of the executives were tried in absentia as they have left the country .
#Text=They had all been charged with manslaughter stemming from safety violations on the ship .
#Text=Convicted was Salaheddin Gomaa , captain of nearby ferry Saint Catherine .
#Text=He was jailed for six months after the court found he did not come to the stricken al-Salam 98 ' s aid .
#Text=It found he " did not do his duty by failing to go to the rescue of victims , " and that he failed to show any compassion .
#Text=The last reported point where the al Salam Boccaccio 98 was observed by coastal radar .
#Text=Image : Rune . welsh .
#Text=The ship went down in the Red Sea near Egyptian port Safaga , where the trial was held , having departed earlier from Saudi Arabia ' s Dhaba port .
#Text=A parliamentary report balmed the disaster 's scale on the owners , as well as the government and Panama , the state where the ship was registered .
#Text=The report said al-Salam had kept operating the ship " despite serious defects " with her , and that the government had " failed to manage the crisis adequately " in the following days .

#Text=It was found that the 36-year-old al-Salam 98 ' s safety documents were forged , that the ship 's extuinguishers and life rafts were not fit for purpose and that there were an inadequate number of winches to lower the rafts into the sea .
#Text=However , the elder Ismail had put the blame on his ferry 's captain , who he claimed wrongly believed the crew could deal with the fire when it broke out .
#Text=The captain was amongst the dead .

#Text=Ismail 's assets were frozen and a travel ban was imposed on him following the disaster , but both were lifted later that year after he paid E£ 300,000,000 ( US$ 57,000,000 ) into a victim 's compensation fund .
#Text=Many victims were poor Egyptian migrant workers , and some were bringing home savings accumulated over months or years .
#Text=The Misdemeanor Court 's acquittal of all except Gomaa — who was fined E£10,000 ( US$ 1,887 ) — met with anger from relatives , who turned out en masse to hear the verdicts .
#Text=One man told al-Jazeera "
